intro: Licaria guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan licaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
